main event: Seven lights observed in a V formation between Warren and Toledo, Ohio on April 15, 1960.
interesting points: The lights were first seen rotating before stabilizing in formation,The observer viewed the lights for 10-15 minutes while driving,The lights remained on the same level and direction throughout the observation,The observer estimated the size of the lights as the size of a pen at arm's length,The report concludes with potential explanations including balloons and aircraft.
